item.title: Entry-level Mac receives a new look
item.description: Apple has reduced the starting price of the Mac mini, making it their most affordable computer. The updated Mac mini features a fourth-generation Intel Core processor, improved integrated graphics, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and Thunderbolt 2 connectivity. According to Philip Schiller, Appleâ€™s Senior VP of Worldwide Marketing, the Mac mini is a great starting point for new Mac users. He highlights the latest CPU, graphics, faster Wi-Fi, two Thunderbolt 2 ports, OS X Yosemite, and a starting price of just US$499 as key features.

item.title: The new iPad Air 2 from Apple is thinner
item.description: Apple unveiled its slimmest iPad yet, the iPad Air 2, at a highly anticipated event on October 16th. The updated iPad boasts an enhanced Retina display for improved contrast, a richer color palette, and superior cameras. Available in gold, alongside the classic silver and space gray, both the iPad Air 2 and the new iPad mini 3 feature Touch ID. In the US, these models will also offer Apple Pay, a new payment system.
